title: Personal Logo
content:
Hi All,

I recently whipped up a logo for my personal design business after I realized I never had a card to give anyone. I am going to change this when I put together my final portfolio together next year. What I am looking for is a general critique or suggestions for me to emphasize my concept. Color suggestions would be nice too. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080606040055im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo_3576.jpg)

 [‹ Real Estate appraiser logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080606040055/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45816 "Go to previous forum topic") [brushscript logo - where to from here? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080606040055/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46041 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ryan.bruner

comments.content:
Hi Ryan.

What’s your concept there?  
I my opinion it needs to get a little stronger, more expressive. I believe it may not work well on smaller sizes.  
I like the type and the colors though.

Cheers.  
Pedro Peixoto
It doesn’t read as rb to me, but rather 7-raised hyphen-0. Consistency would dictate you’d have the shadow line on the right side of the b’s ascender, too.

It doesn’t read as rb to me either. I only realized that it was an ’rb’ when I read your name. Are you just fiddling around with this on the computer, or are you starting from pencil and paper sketches?

—  
Nick Hladek
